title: Explore Your R Libraries

title: Explore Your R Libraries
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(libminer)  lib_summary() #>                                                                    library #> 1                                       C:/Program Files/R/R-4.2.1/library #> 2                        C:/Users/lforeste/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.2 #> 3 C:/Users/lforeste/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmpewlfsw/temp_libpath517c12e42592 #>   n_packages #> 1         30 #> 2        172 #> 3          1  # You can also ask it to calculate sizes: lib_summary(sizes = TRUE) #>                                                                    library #> 1                                       C:/Program Files/R/R-4.2.1/library #> 2                        C:/Users/lforeste/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.2 #> 3 C:/Users/lforeste/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmpewlfsw/temp_libpath517c12e42592 #>   n_packages  lib_size #> 1         30  69711557 #> 2        172 511330907 #> 3          1     13058

title: R Library Summary — lib_summary
text: Provides brief summary package libraries machine.

title: R Library Summary — lib_summary
text: sizes logical indicating whether calculate sizes

title: R Library Summary — lib_summary
code: lib_summary() #>                           library n_packages #> 1 /home/runner/work/_temp/Library         69 #> 2      /opt/R/4.3.1/lib/R/library         29 #> 3 /opt/R/4.3.1/lib/R/site-library          1 lib_summary(sizes = TRUE) #>                           library n_packages lib_size #> 1 /home/runner/work/_temp/Library         69 71414561 #> 2      /opt/R/4.3.1/lib/R/library         29 69574120 #> 3 /opt/R/4.3.1/lib/R/site-library          1 14569622
